docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: At the end of the 1957 film ''The Three Faces of Eve,'' which depicted the struggle of a young woman with multiple personality disorder, Eve, the title character, drives off with a new husband and her young daughter, presumably cured, to live happily ever after.

headline.main: The Real 'Eve' Sues to Film the Rest of Her Story

docs.snippet: LEAD: Mr. and Mrs. Harvey Gaberman of Fairfield, Conn., have made known the engagement of their daughter Leslie Sue Gaberman to John Brooks Harkavy, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Oscar Harkavy of New Rochelle, N.Y. Miss Gaberman, an associate at the Bosto...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Mr. and Mrs. Harvey Gaberman of Fairfield, Conn., have made known the engagement of their daughter Leslie Sue Gaberman to John Brooks Harkavy, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Oscar Harkavy of New Rochelle, N.Y. Miss Gaberman, an associate at the Boston law firm of Nissen & Lumsden, graduated from Lafayette College and received a J.D.

docs.snippet: LEAD: The grand inaugural get-together is a new Latin American tradition, a way of celebrating yet another peaceful and democratic transfer of power. It is now the seventh time in a row for Venezuela, but last week's gathering for the swearing in ...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The grand inaugural get-together is a new Latin American tradition, a way of celebrating yet another peaceful and democratic transfer of power. It is now the seventh time in a row for Venezuela, but last week's gathering for the swearing in of President Carlos Andres Perez was something special.

docs.snippet: LEAD: STILL HAGGARD AND GAUNT FROM his time in the mountains of El Salvador, the guerrilla official put a recording of a Haydn symphony on the stereo and sat down to talk. It was his 13th year of fighting to overthrow his country's government. As ...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: STILL HAGGARD AND GAUNT FROM his time in the mountains of El Salvador, the guerrilla official put a recording of a Haydn symphony on the stereo and sat down to talk. It was his 13th year of fighting to overthrow his country's government. As Haydn's reassuring tones filled the room, the rebel visibly relaxed, safe now in a nearby country outside El Salvador.

byline.original: By James LeMoyne: James LeMoyne reported on Central America for six years. From 1984 until 1988, he was chief of The Times's San Salvador bureau

docs.snippet: LEAD: On her whirlwind visit to New York this week, the Princess of Wales's good looks transcended her clothes. Her neatly groomed blond hair and greyhound-slim figure, along with her gracious personality, impressed those she met as well as those ...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: On her whirlwind visit to New York this week, the Princess of Wales's good looks transcended her clothes. Her neatly groomed blond hair and greyhound-slim figure, along with her gracious personality, impressed those she met as well as those who just glimpsed her during receptions, tours and the opera.

docs.snippet: LEAD: The Spanish national oil company, Repsol Exploration S.A., said it would offer up to 30 percent of its stock to private investors in the country's biggest privatization. The offering could raise around 165 billion pesetas, or about $1.38 bil...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The Spanish national oil company, Repsol Exploration S.A., said it would offer up to 30 percent of its stock to private investors in the country's biggest privatization. The offering could raise around 165 billion pesetas, or about $1.38 billion, an analyst said. About a third of the shares will be offered to institutional investors in the United States, Japan, West Germany, France, Britain and Switzerland, Repsol's chairman, Oscar Fanjul, said.

docs.snippet: LEAD: Now it can be told, if not too effectively: a number of the Viet Cong guerrillas were good, brave, idealistic freedom fighters. The only easily identifiable villains in the Vietnam War were Communist Party functionaries....
